text: as time passes in this war it's clear
russian forces are gradually stepping up
the severity of their attacks and
bombardments we've seen key
infrastructure targets being hit such as
the nuclear plant overnight and the tv
tower of course earlier this week and
that huge column of troops stationed on
the northern approach road to kiev
hasn't gone away though according to
some military analysts it's bogged down
in mud as the snow's thaw so what path
is the war likely to take in the days
ahead here's frank gardner with his
assessment
so here's the strategic picture in
ukraine on day nine of this invasion the
areas in red as you can see there are
the ones that russian forces control
still attacking ukraine from three
angles from the north the east and the
south now the big news is that overnight
russian forces incredibly have shelled
the largest nuclear plant in the whole
of europe at a place called zepergia
right here and it started a fire
causing global outrage uh it's been
condemned by leaders all over the world
as reckless horrific unacceptable it's
been called nuclear terror by the
president of ukraine mercifully the fire
is out we're told there is no increased
radiation russian forces are now in
control of that plant but it's not the
only nuclear plant in the whole of
ukraine there are other ones you can see
at klemnicki here at rivno and up in
chernobyl which russian forces control
the plant that exploded in 1986
now most of the action most of the
fighting has been done in the south down
here where russian forces have burst out
of crimea expanding eastwards encircling
the town of mario paul cutting off
electricity food water making an
absolutely horrendous time for the
residents there there is a lot of fear
and speculation in ukraine that there's
an amphibious assault about to be
launched on odessa if they do that
russia will be in control of pretty much
the whole black sea coast cutting off
ukraine from the sea
